Name: Allocation of funds from the E911 system surcharge.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the allocation of funds from the E911 system surcharge.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
	Section one. Subdivision g of section 11-2322 of the administrative code of the city of New York is hereby amended to read as follows:
	� 11-2322. Definitions.
	(g) "System costs" means the costs associated with obtaining and maintaining the telecommunication equipment and the telephone services costs necessary to establish and provide an E911 system.  Such costs shall not include the funding of employee salaries. 
	� 2. This local law shall take effect 90 days after its enactment into law.


LS# 2067

\ul Be it enacted by the Council as follows:\par
\ulnone\tab Section one. Subdivision g of section 11-2322 of the administrative code of the city of New York is hereby amended to read as follows:\par
\tab\'a7 11-2322. Definitions.\par
\tab (g) \ldblquote System costs\rdblquote  means the costs associated with obtaining and maintaining the telecommunication equipment and the telephone services costs necessary to establish and provide an E911 system.  \ul Such costs shall not include the funding of employee salaries. \par
\ulnone\tab\'a7 2. This local law shall take effect 90 days after its enactment into law.\par
